events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car, resulting in moderate damage to the front bumper and hood.
Claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing initial details of the incident and vehicle involvement.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to coordinate further processes and communication with the customer.
The claim has been formally acknowledged and the customer was informed about the next steps for documentation and investigation.
Request sent to the customer for submitting photos of vehicle damage and the police collision report to proceed with evaluation.
Customer has provided all requested documents including images of damaged car parts and the official accident report from authorities.
The insurance investigation team has begun analyzing the submitted evidence and contacting relevant parties involved in the accident.
Investigation concluded confirming fault based on collision details and inspection reports, supporting customer's claim request.
A settlement offer has been proposed to cover the repair costs and associated expenses related to the vehicle accident damages.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and the timely handling of their auto accident claim.
The insurance claim was officially approved and authorization for payment issuance was granted to cover the vehicle repair costs.
Payment has been issued to the customer's designated repair shop for the costs covered under the approved auto accident claim.
The claim file was officially closed after successful completion of the payment and customer confirmation of repairs.
All documents and transaction records related to the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference.
